intro: Lagenophora solenogyne, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, elongated leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a distinctive, narrow calyx. Lagenophora solenogyne is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or along stream banks.
